title: More than 220 jobs at risk as Ineos eyes closure at Teeside chemicals plant
text:
Ineos has launched a consultation on the potential closure of a manufacturing plant which employs more than 220 people.

The chemicals company said not all the jobs will be lost if it decides to close the Seal Sands acrylonitrile plant on Teesside because of other activities at the site.

A statement said that despite investing more than £180million to counter decades of 'significant' under-investment, the company believes nothing more can be done to ensure operations are safe and economically viable.

Ineos said not all the jobs will be lost if it decides to close the Seal Sands acrylonitrile plant on Teesside because of other activities at the site which Ineos has owned for over a decade

Acrylonitrile is an organic compound used in the manufacture of some plastics.

The plant would require another £180million just to meet standards and environmental regulations, Ineos said.

Paul Overment, of Ineos, added: 'After considering many options, we feel that we must now consult with employees on the potential closure of the plant.

'We do so with a heavy heart but there is no escaping the fact that decades of under-investment on the site have led us to this point.'
